Description: Part of the limestone base of a figure of Horemheb: deeply incised along its surviving side with the prenomen of Horemheb with epithets.The left edge of this piece is lost, and the surface of the stone is worn in several places. There are no traces of colour.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/24,30,114-117. The Great Temple, Sanctuary.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: H. Frankfort, 'Journal of Egyptian Archeology' 13 (1927), 210; J. S. Pendlebury, 'City of Akhenaten' III (London. 1951), 12, no. 26/s 24 and pl. LX, no. 3; R. Hari, 'Horemheb et Moutnedjmet' (Geneva, 1964), 284, no. 33 and pl. L.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1982 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 10. (pl.2-3)
Condition: Fair (incomplete). The left edge of this piece is lost, and the surface of the stone is worn in several places
